user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_digest_auth_calc_userdigest:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_digest_auth_calc_userdigest (enum MHD_DigestAuthAlgo3 algo3,
                                 const char *username,
                                 const char *realm,
                                 const char *password,
                                 void *userdigest_bin,
                                 size_t bin_buf_size)
{
  struct DigestAlgorithm da;
  enum MHD_Result ret;
  if (! digest_init_one_time (&da, get_base_digest_algo (algo3)))
    return MHD_NO;

  if (digest_get_size (&da) > bin_buf_size)
    ret = MHD_NO;
  else
  {
    calc_userdigest (&da,
                     username,
                     strlen (username),
                     realm,
                     strlen (realm),
                     password,
                     userdigest_bin);
    ret = MHD_YES;

#ifdef MHD_DIGEST_HAS_EXT_ERROR
    if (digest_ext_error (&da))
      ret = MHD_NO;
#endif /* MHD_DIGEST_HAS_EXT_ERROR */
  }
  digest_deinit (&da);

  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:
calc_userdigest (&da,
                     username,
                     strlen (username),
                     realm,
                     strlen (realm),
                     password,
                     userdigest_bin);
explanation: Other pointer usages in the function do not require investigation for Rule 8.13: username, realm and password are already const-qualified (const char *). The address-of operator on the local variable da (e.g. &da passed to digest_init_one_time and digest_deinit) is used to allow those functions to modify the DigestAlgorithm instance, so a const qualification would be inappropriate. Size parameters (bin_buf_size, the results of strlen) are non-pointer scalar values. No other pointer parameters or pointer-returning expressions appear in the shown code that could/should be made const.
